Class ChessGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChessGame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EuropeanChess, Xiangqi

    public abstract class ChessGame
extends java.lang.Object
    An interface that encodes specific rules for a version of chess.
    Author:
    Harold Connamacher, Escanord Le

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ChessGame.Side
      The "side" or "team" or "player" the piece belongs to.

        creates a chess game with given row and columns
        Parameters:
        numRows - the number of rows of the chess game
        numColumns - the number of columns of the chess game
        firstPlayer - the string indicating the first player of the game
        secondPlayer - the string indicating the second player of the game
        board - the board of the game

        public boolean legalPieceToPlay(ChessPiece piece,
                                int row,
                                int column)
        determines if the piece is legal to play or not
        Parameters:
        piece - the given piece to be checked
        row - the row of the given piece
        column - the column of the given piece
        Returns:
        true if the piece is legal to be played

      • makeMove

        public abstract boolean makeMove(ChessPiece piece,
                                 int toRow,
                                 int toColumn)
        Moves a piece to a new position.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to move
        toRow - the row of the square the piece is moving to
        toColumn - the column of the square the piece is moving to
        Returns:
        true if the move was made, false if the move was not made

      • canChangeSelection

        public boolean canChangeSelection(ChessPiece piece,
                                  int row,
                                  int column)
        Returns whether a user can choose a different piece from the one selected or if they have to move the selected piece. If this method returns false, then the legalPieceToPlay method must not return true if that piece has no legal moves. Otherwise the game could freeze with a player not permitted to change selection of a piece with no legal moves.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece the user selected
        row - the row of the square the piece is on
        column - the column of the square the piece is on
        Returns:
        true if the player can change the piece they selected and false if they cannot and must move that piece

      • getNumRows

        public int getNumRows()
        returns the number of rows of this chess game
        Returns:
        the number of rows of this chess game

      • getNumColumns

        int getNumColumns()
        returns the number of columns of this chess game
        Returns:
        the number of columns of this chess game

      • startGame

        public abstract void startGame(ChessBoard board)
        places all piece of this chess game onto the given board and begins some neccessary initialization for the chess game
        Parameters:
        board - the given board of the chess game
